question: Can I afford a monthly mortgage payment on a $250,000 house with a $70,000 annual income?
true_answer: Yes, with a $70,000 income, you can afford a $250,000 house, assuming a monthly payment around 28% of your income.

steps.content: Can I afford a monthly mortgage payment on a $250,000 house with a $70,000 annual income?
Plan: 1) Calculate monthly income. 2) Hand off to home_loan_agent to assess payment feasibility. 3) Involve credit_agent for credit score context. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Calculating monthly income based on $70,000 annual income.
Retrieving knowledge on mortgage affordability guidelines.
Guidelines suggest mortgage payment should be around 28% of monthly income.
Calculating affordable mortgage payment as 28% of $5,833.
Affordable monthly payment calculated as approximately $1,633.
Credit score context check: Assuming credit score is healthy.
What if my credit score is not great? Will it affect the affordability?
Retrieving knowledge on effects of credit score on mortgage rates.
Lower credit scores may lead to higher interest rates, increasing monthly payments.
Review complete, all checks passed. User's income supports the mortgage.
Yes, with a $70,000 income, you can afford a $250,000 house, assuming a monthly payment around 28% of your income.
